title: The Gospel According to Bill O’Reilly Continued
post:
I watched the video and read the various comments on the CBS site. I’d echo one of the comments from a non-USA person, that the rest of us just cannot understand how so many in the USA can get suckered in by this type of so-called celebrity, of which there seem to be far too many. He has a huge following, some pay $500 merely to have their photo taken with this person.  None of the comments on the CBS site however were favourable.  In NZ we tend to have a healthy habit of cutting “tall poppies” down to size.  The interview with O’Reilly helped to me to understand why this is such a healthy practice.
Norah O’Donnell asked all the right questions, but with responses of only self-satisfied smugness from O’Reilly.  The pretence of the man is transparent to the rest of us.  Why isn’t it in the USA? Are their live so shallow that they can be taken in by this person?
author: daveb of wellington nz
